ad_creative_bodies:
Over 140 Pacific Gateway hotel workers – mostly women and racialized – lost their jobs after the federal government commandeered the hotel to use as a quarantine site.  A human rights complaint alleging sex and racial discrimination has been filed against the hotel on behalf of the terminated women.  For months, workers asked Liberal MPs and Ministers why the feds continue to subsidize this hotel.  Instead of relocating, the federal government is now EXTENDING its stay through December 2021. 
 
How is this “moving forward together?” 

#Elxn44  #UnequalWomen
ad_creative_body:
Over 140 Pacific Gateway hotel workers – mostly women and racialized – lost their jobs after the federal government commandeered the hotel to use as a quarantine site.  A human rights complaint alleging sex and racial discrimination has been filed against the hotel on behalf of the terminated women.  For months, workers asked Liberal MPs and Ministers why the feds continue to subsidize this hotel.  Instead of relocating, the federal government is now EXTENDING its stay through December 2021. 
 
How is this “moving forward together?” 

#Elxn44  #UnequalWomen

ad_creative_bodies: Justin Trudeau's government took over the Pacific Gateway Hotel as a federal quarantine site when the pandemic hit. 142 hotel workers, mostly women, permanently lost their jobs. Why is the government leaving workers behind?
ad_creative_body: Justin Trudeau's government took over the Pacific Gateway Hotel as a federal quarantine site when the pandemic hit. 142 hotel workers, mostly women, permanently lost their jobs. Why is the government leaving workers behind?

ad_creative_bodies:
Take Action: Help Locked-out #HiltonMetrotown workers by sending a message today to South Korean Ambassadors to Canada and the U.S.!

The hotel, owned by Seoul-based firm DSDL Co., laid off most of its staff when the pandemic hit. Workers asked the hotel to commit to recall them as work becomes available again. DSDL refused. Instead, the hotel terminated 97 workers. Then, they locked out the rest. This is the 5th month of the lockout!   Ambassadors Lee Soo-hyuck and Keung Ryong Chang – tell DSDL to stop its poor treatment of workers!
#BCUnequalWomen 

https://actionnetwork.org/letters/dsdl/
ad_creative_body:

Instead, the hotel terminated 97 workers. Then, they locked out the rest. This is the 5th month of the lockout! ad_creative_bodies:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, 142 long-term workers - mostly women with decades on the job - were fired from Pacific Gateway Hotel after your government took it over in March 2020 to use as a federal quarantine site. Despite knowing the impact on women, the federal government just extended the contract with the hotel again. 
Why is your government still subsidizing this hotel?

ad_creative_bodies:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, 142 long-term workers have been fired from Pacific Gateway hotel, a quarantine site for travellers. Many of the fired workers are women of colour. Is this what you call a feminist recovery?

#BCUnequalWomen #NoJusticeTrudeau #NotTrueTrudeau #bcpoli #cdnpoli #PacificGatewayhotel

ad_creative_bodies: Cecilia Rutter, locked-out Hilton Metrotown worker: "To be locked out this long, since April 16th this year, is an all-time low.  That's why we're expanding the boycott to Alberta and fighting back for all DSDL workers who are being mistreated." Today, Alberta unions rallied outside the Varscona Hotel in Edmonton in support of locked out Hilton Metrotown staff. The Alberta Federation of Labour announced their support for expanding the boycott to Edmonton hotels owned by DSDL to include Varscona, Mettera and Matrix Hotel beginning August 8th. #Solidarity!
ad_creative_body: Cecilia Rutter, locked-out Hilton Metrotown worker: "To be locked out this long, since April 16th this year, is an all-time low.  That's why we're expanding the boycott to Alberta and fighting back for all DSDL workers who are being mistreated." Today, Alberta unions rallied outside the Varscona Hotel in Edmonton in support of locked out Hilton Metrotown staff. The Alberta Federation of Labour announced their support for expanding the boycott to Edmonton hotels owned by DSDL to include Varscona, Mettera and Matrix Hotel beginning August 8th. #Solidarity!

ad_creative_bodies:
Thank you for marching with locked out #HiltonMetrotown workers today on the picket line, Jagmeet Singh! NDP leader Jagmeet Singh delivered a message of hope, strength, and solidarity to workers, many of whom are women and people of colour. Today is day 83 of the lockout and workers have no intention of giving up — we're willing to do what it takes to fight for our jobs! ✊

#burnabyisbetterthanhilton
#HiltonMetrotown
#NDP #BCNDP #bcpoli #vanpoli #cdnpoli 
#BCUnequalWomen #Burnaby

ad_creative_bodies:
"How much has the government spent on this hotel while women like me are treated like we're disposable?" - Local 40 member Elisa Cardona testifying today before the House of Commons Standing Committee on Health about Pacific Gateway Hotel.  While the federal government controls this hotel, women are bearing the brunt of pandemic firings - prompting a human rights complaint over sex and racial discrimination.  See part of Elisa's testimony:  https://rb.gy/lemhv4 
#UnequalWomen #FeministRecovery #COVID19 #HESA

ad_creative_bodies:
Unite Here Local 40 says the South Asian woman filed the complaint this week with the BC Human Rights Tribunal on behalf of herself and 89 other women alleging sex and racial discrimination.

#BCUnequalWomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli
ad_creative_body:
Unite Here Local 40 says the South Asian woman filed the complaint this week with the BC Human Rights Tribunal on behalf of herself and 89 other women alleging sex and racial discrimination.

#BCUnequalWomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli
ad_creative_link_description: The women allege that during the COVID-19 pandemic terminations at the hotel disparately impacted women, and women of colour, while men’s jobs were more likely to be protected.
ad_creative_link_descriptions: The women allege that during the COVID-19 pandemic terminations at the hotel disparately impacted women, and women of colour, while men’s jobs were more likely to be protected.

ad_creative_bodies:
Thanks, MP Peter Julian for supporting hotel workers! To find out which hotels won’t commit to return workers to their jobs, go to https://www.bcunequalwomen.org/bc-travel-alert/  

Canada’s NDP / Le NPD du Canada BC NDP #FeminstRecovery #BCUnequalWomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli

ad_creative_bodies:
ACTION! 💥 Tell PM Justin Trudeau to support women at #PacificGateway by making sure they are reinstated or move the goverment's business somewhere else!
He promised a "feminist recovery." But he won't protect 100 women at the hotel he controls. #NotTrueTrudeau
https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/not-true-trudeau

ad_creative_link_description: Pacific Gateway Hotel, which was taken over by the federal government last year, has fired over 140 workers – including 82 of them on May 1. Women, many from South Asian and Chinese communities, are bearing the brunt and treated like they're disposable. What is happening at Pacific Gateway is a di...

#Solidarity #cdnpoli #canlab #UnequalWomen #FeministRecovery

ad_creative_bodies:
"No hotel should treat women like they're disposable. Firing and replacing workers for less is not feminism. A truly inclusive recovery means women are returned to their jobs as the industry recovers. That's why I support the BC Unequal Women campaign. 
- MP Jenny Kwan, Vancouver East

#BCUnequalWomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli #canlab #bclab

"No hotel should treat women like they're disposable. Firing and replacing workers for less is not feminism. A truly inclusive recovery means women are returned to their jobs as the industry recovers. That's why I support the BC Unequal Women campaign. 
- MP Jenny Kwan, Vancouver East

#BCUnequalWomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli #canlab #bclab

#bcunequalwomen #bcpoli #cdnpoli #PacificGatewayHotel

ad_creative_bodies:
Thank you, Don Davies (MP Vancouver Kingsway), for supporting our campaign!  Don’t stay at hotels that treat women like they’re disposable. Check out the list of BC hotels that have agreed – or have not agreed – to retain staff and commit to bring them back as business recovers.  No one should lose her job because of a public health crisis. https://www.bcunequalwomen.org/bc-travel-alert/
Canada’s NDP / Le NPD du Canada

ad_creative_bodies:
TAKE ACTION! 🔥 ‼
On May Day, Hilton Metrotown workers are wondering whether or not they can pay the bills. Hilton Metrotown has cut off almost 50 of its laid-off workers’ EI in a direct attack on its locked out and laid-off workers. This comes as the hotel’s lockout enters its 3rd week after terminating 97 workers, and affects those, primarily women and people of colour, who have been out of work for months.

Sign the petition and urge Employment Minister Carla Qualtrough (MP-Delta) to intervene and protect laid-off Hilton Metrotown workers now!  
https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/mpqualtrough-protectworkers/

ad_creative_bodies:
Burnaby councillor Joe Keithley, said the vote was unanimous after what he called a “despicable” move by the hotel to fire nearly 100 workers.

“It’s a David and Goliath situation. You have this massive corporation versus hardworking Burnaby residents who are struggling to get by,” he said.
ad_creative_body:
Burnaby councillor Joe Keithley, said the vote was unanimous after what he called a “despicable” move by the hotel to fire nearly 100 workers.

“It’s a David and Goliath situation. You have this massive corporation versus hardworking Burnaby residents who are struggling to get by,” he said.
ad_creative_link_description: 'It's a David and Goliath situation,' says Burnaby councillor Joe Keithley. The city has vowed not to support events or promote any business with Hilton Vancouver Metrotown unless the company and union reach a fair settlement.
ad_creative_link_descriptions: 'It's a David and Goliath situation,' says Burnaby councillor Joe Keithley. The city has vowed not to support events or promote any business with Hilton Vancouver Metrotown unless the company and union reach a fair settlement.
ad_creative_link_title: COVID-19: Burnaby passes motion to support laid off hotel workers
ad_creative_link_titles: COVID-19: Burnaby passes motion to support laid off hotel workers
